poem:
Title: The Postman's Predicament 

Post Office, harbour of hopes in letters sealed,
Democracy's servants, to justice appealed.
True villainy veiled, beneath Horizon's shroud,
Rise, spectral truths, speak aloud.

Sir David Davis stands, a hallowed knight,
In the Commons' storm, a beacon of right,
Four deeds beckon, urgency unfurled,
Exoneration awaits, in this postmarked world.
